comments.text:
Created attachment 8959696
Screen Shot 2018-03-16 at 13.49.06.png

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.13; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0
Build ID: 20180315232954

Steps to reproduce:

I open a few tabs in Firefox and then try to switch between them. First, it takes a few millisecond before anything happens, then FF switches to the tab (that was already opened before). 


Actual results:

Instead of showing the page, I see a spinner in the middle of the page on a gray background. 


Expected results:

When the FF window is smaller, tab switching is instant. I believe this is related to the high resolution of my screen. I am using a 4K monitor on OSX.
comments.author: domoritz@gmail.com

comments.text:
Hi Dominik,

Could you please take and post a performance profile using https://perf-html.io/ as you are reproducing this issue?
comments.author: ciprian.muresan@softvision.ro
ciprian.muresan@softvision.ro

comments.text:
This looks like slow painting / layer upload to me:

https://perfht.ml/2pvOQqo
comments.author: mconley@mozilla.com

comments.text: Unfortunately, I won't have time to run the mozregression this week. I will try to get to it after next week unless this is confirmed to be a graphics issue. I believe it is as I don't have any problems when I use a smaller window.
comments.author: domoritz@gmail.com

comments.text: I don't think this issue started recently but probably came with the introduction of Quantum. I didn't use previous Firefox versions on a large monitor.
comments.author: domoritz@gmail.com

comments.text: I'll have access to my large monitor again tomorrow. What version range should I look at?
comments.author: domoritz@gmail.com

comments.text:
As the "bad" version, use today's date.
As the "good" version: if you remember a Firefox version where this didn't happen, use that; otherwise, use older dates until you find one that is good.
comments.author: mcastelluccio@mozilla.com

comments.text: It looks like it's much better now with some recent MacOS/Firefox updates. I still see the spinner from time to time but it's not as bad as it used to be. I'm going to close this issue and hope that further performance improvements for Firefox on MacOS resolve this issue entirely later.
comments.author: domoritz@gmail.com

comments.text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 1425916 ***
comments.author: domoritz@gmail.com

assigned_to_detail.name: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Jeff Muizelaar [:jrmuizel] on parental leave until at least June 25

summary: Lag when switching tabs on OSX with high resolution
